definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: B. They are very sweet, they must be in season.
sentences.chinese: 它們很甜，一定是應時的。

sentences.english: It is a cake steamed with the rice or rice flour with big stickiness, seasonable food for lunar calendar year.
sentences.chinese: 用黏性大的米或米粉蒸成的糕，是農曆年的應時食品。

sentences.english: Partnering with OHRIA is a natural fit.
sentences.chinese: 與安大略賽馬業協會合作是應時的舉動？

sentences.english: I enjoy any fruit that's in season.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡喫任何應時的水果。

sentences.english: The fresh, seasonal produce will be piled high and priced low.
sentences.chinese: 新鮮應時的產品堆積的很高，標價卻很低廉。

definition: timely/at the right moment/appropriate to the occasion/opportune/to fit current fashion
that being the case/then/in that case
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
junior scholar or pupil in imperial China
to restore old way/to return to the past
(of income etc) to be unassured/to lack a reliable source
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
